titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 477: Miscellanea di poesie del secolo XVIII

msContents.summary: Volume is a composite consisting of several parts written in different hands, on different sizes of paper. Most poems have no indication of authors except Vai (f. 12r, f. 32r-35r); Giovanni Batt. Ricciardi (f. 12v-28r; 35v-47r); Francesco Melosi (f. 29r-31r); Malatesti (f. 48r-50v); N.N. (directed against "raccolta Panciatichi," f. 93r-96v); note on otherwise blank f. 117v "Accademia del P. Pellegrino Batolozzi."

msItem.title: Miscellanea di poesie del secolo XVIII
msItem.author: Del Ricciardi, Giovanni Battista, 1623-1686

msItem.title: La dulcinea trionfante [unfinished pastoral romance in prose], f. 1r
Miscellaneous poetry [religious verse, odes, epigrams, etc.] by several authors, f. 12v
Serenata a? quattro: soprano, soprano, contralto, tenore [libretti for serenades, dramatic dialogues], f. 53r
Miscellaneous poetry including satirical sonnets regarding the betrothal of Sig. Niccolo? Panciatichi (f.93-94) and a bestiary in verse (f.98-113), f. 61r
Stravaganza di nostro tempo [satire, intended for music?], f. 119r
Religious and other verse, including Stabat Mater Dolorosa, (f. 145), f. 141r

supportDesc.extent: 153 leaves : 193 x 132 to 214 x 159 mm. bound to 228 x 175 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 153; [ii], 1-148, [149 blank]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in various scripts by more than 20 different hands.

binding.p: Quarter parchment. Some sections have water damage and/or sections torn from the bottom corner, resulting in the loss of some text.
